content: fern lace socks this toe-up sock design was inspired by the ferns and undergrowth of the deep dark woods it can also be knit in yellow to create a golden field of wheat abbreviations k = knit yo = yarn over p = purl k3tog = knit 3 together st = stitch sk2po = slip 1 st knit 2 sts together pass slipped st over m = make ktbl = knit through back loo foot co 24st 12 on each needle with judy s magic cast on keep half of your stitches on each side of your magic loop or separate equally onto 4 dpn s knit in the round increasing 4 sts every other round as follows k1 m1 then knit to 1st before you reach the halfway point m1 k2 m1 knit to 1st before end of round m1 k1 repeat this until you reach 64 sts you will have 32 sts on each half of the magic loop or 16 sts on each of four dpn s if you use 9 circulars this is the best point to switch over to them and add stitch markers for the beginning and midpoint 32st of the round this is the point you will start using the fern lace instructions at the end of the pattern you will knit in lace pattern on the first half of your stitches and knit stockinette on the second half you will continue knitting the first top half of the sock in lace and the bottom second half in stockinette until you reach 2 5in ~6 4cm less than your desired foot length when measured from toe to heel make sure to note at what point in the pattern you reach the desired length so you can continue in pattern when you are done with the heel next you will turn your heel note if you usually need a deeper heel increase the second half of the sock by 6-8 sts by increasing evenly across the stockinette section 1 row before you start your heel once you finish your short row heel you will decrease the same number of stitches you initially increased on the final knit row of your short row shaping heel knit the first half of the sock in lace pattern and then begin your german short row heel as follows abbreviations mds make double stitch ds double stitch to make a double stitch insert needle as if to purl with yarn in front slip_stitch off the needle pull working yarn strongly to back so the slipped st falls to the back and the stitch in the row below is pulled up over the right hand needle first half of heel knit to one stitch before end of round turn you re now on the ws mds purl all st to reach the last heel st turn you re now on the rs mds k to the next double stitch ds turn do not work the double stitch mds p up
